Kernel/sources/timers/pit.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include "pit.h"
00002 #include <interrupts/idt.h>
00003 
00004 static clock_callback on_pit_tick = 0;
00005 
00006 static idt_call_registers_t pitOnTickCallback(idt_call_registers_t regs)
00007 {
00008         if (on_pit_tick)
00009         {
00010                 on_pit_tick(); //Call the pit callback
00011         }
00012 }
00013 
00014 void initializePit(uint32 frequency)
00015 {
00016    // Firstly, register our timer callback.
00017    register_interrupt_handler(GET_IRQ(0), &pitOnTickCallback);
00018 
00019    // The value we send to the PIT is the value to divide it's input clock
00020    // (1193180 Hz) by, to get our required frequency. Important to note is
00021    // that the divisor must be small enough to fit into 16-bits.
00022    uint32 divisor = 1193180 / frequency;
00023 
00024    // Send the command byte.
00025    outb(0x43, 0x36);
00026 
00027    // Divisor has to be sent byte-wise, so split here into upper/lower bytes.
00028    uint8 l = (uint8)(divisor & 0xFF);
00029    uint8 h = (uint8)( (divisor>>8) & 0xFF );
00030 
00031    // Send the frequency divisor.
00032    outb(0x40, l);
00033    outb(0x40, h);
00034 }
00035 
00036 void setPitCallback(clock_callback cb)
00037 {
00038         on_pit_tick = cb;
00039 }
